column13: WiseTech launched the new Earn & Learn program, which combines work at WiseTech and part-time university study. Through this program, WiseTech supports computing undergraduates to hit the ground running by combining academic theory with real-world application in a work setting.
column20: Earn & Learn, university study, work setting

column6: New employee hires and employee turnover
column13: WiseTech hosted more than 20 student interns during the year in its Sydney and Nanjing offices who came to WiseTech independently or via university partnerships. Interns at WiseTech are placed into its main rotations program to build experience across different teams before being carefully embedded into a team and provided with mentoring.
column20: Main rotations program, student intern, university partnership

column6: New employee hires and employee turnover
column13: This year, WiseTech's Shape Your Career campaign focused on WiseTech as an employer of choice for tech talent. With a wider ramp-up of its recruitment activity, WiseTech saw a significant growth in the number of unique and overall user visits to its website's careers and job openings pages and a significant uplift in job applications to WiseTech following the campaign.
column20: Shape Your Career, tech talent, job opening page

column6: New employee hires and employee turnover
column13: WiseTech developed its Graduate Program for accountants within the Finance team. The program builds comprehensive knowledge and skills in finance and the skills and tools required to succeed in the workplace. Participants in the program rotate through various teams in the Finance department every six months over three years.
column20: Graduate Program, accountant, Finance team

column6: Benefits provided to full-time employees that are not provided to temporary or part-time employees
Benefits provided to full-time employees that are not provided to temporary or part-time employees
column13: As of 30 June 2023, WiseTech's employee equity plan has covered employees in over 25 countries. The plan was opened to employees based in China during FY23.
column20: Employee equity plan, employee, China

column6: Benefits provided to full-time employees that are not provided to temporary or part-time employees
column13: During the year, WiseTech focused on creating office environments that support engaged and productive teams. WiseTech completed 12 moves from traditional long-term leases to flex spaces worldwide. These spaces prioritise community-making through wellness spaces, event programs and cafes while providing appealing work environments with flexibility to scale.
column20: Flex space, office environment, wellness space

column6: Parental leave
column8: Paid Domestic and Family Violence Policy
column13: Implementation of WiseTech's policies related to D&I continued this year. During this year, WiseTech's Paid Domestic and Family Violence Policy was introduced in 10 additional locations, and it saw an increase in the number of people taking parental leave.
column20: Paid Domestic and Family Violence Policy, D&I, parental leave

column6: Minimum notice periods regarding operational changes
Occupation health and safety management system
Occupation health and safety management system
column13: WiseTech embedded its Workplace Hazards and Incidents process as a critical Work Health Safety (WHS) system. Through this system, all team members can raise incidents or hazards they may identify within the workplace, which includes WiseTech's offices, at home, working remotely in other locations or when travelling for work purposes.
column20: WHS system, incident, hazard

column6: Hazard identification, risk assessment, and incident investigation
Occupational health services
Occupational health services
column13: WiseTech's Employee Assistance Program provider delivered a series of well-being webinars for its people worldwide, covering topics including hobbies for mental and physical health, making connections in work and life, and tips for caring for the body during the workday by exercising.
column20: Employee Assistance Program, well-being webinar, health

column6: Worker participation, consultation, and communication on occupational health and safety
Worker training on occupational health and safety
Worker training on occupational health and safety
column13: WiseTech is committed to providing a safe workplace for its people. This year, WiseTech refreshed its People Leader training on workplace behaviour, psychosocial safety and inclusion. WiseTech Directors also completed psychosocial safety training this year.
column20: Psychosocial safety training, safe workplace, People Leader training

column6: Promotion of worker health
Promotion of worker health
column13: WiseTech maintained its focus on employee well-being this year. WiseTech celebrated World Mental Health Day by celebrating how people protect their mental health. WiseTech also introduced Wellness Wednesdays for team members in its Sydney HQ, with activities such as meditation and yoga sessions, pottery workshops and nutritious brunches.
column20: World Mental Health Day, employee well-being, Wellness Wednesday

column6: Promotion of worker health
column13: As part of a range of team member activities for R U OK Day, an annual national campaign in Australia in support of mental health and suicide prevention, WiseTech held a 'Coffee and Connection Break'. During the session, team members were provided tips and tools for meaningful conversations about mental health.
column20: R U OK Day, mental health, suicide prevention

column6: Promotion of worker health
column13: WiseTech continued its R U OK Day theme by holding virtual global coffee breaks annually. The sessions allowed team members to get to know others worldwide in a fun and relaxed setting.
column20: Global coffee break, R U OK Day, relaxed setting

column6: Promotion of worker health
column13: WiseTech ran two team member Lunch and Learn events at its Sydney office. The events allow hundreds of team members to hear directly from the founders of Two Good Co and Plate It Forward and ask questions about their mission and how WiseTech works with their businesses.
column20: Lunch and Learn, Two Good Co, Plate It Forward

column13: While working at WiseTech, students study a specially crafted blend of University of Technology Sydney (UTS) coursework, content delivered through the WiseTech Academy, and on-the-job training, leading to the completion of a Bachelor of Computing Science degree in four years.
column20: University of Technology Sydney, WiseTech Academy, on-the-job training

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: WiseTech Academy empowers people by providing affordable access to high-quality online education. WiseTech Academy is an online Registered Training Organisation that offers the learning resources needed to develop new skills, advance careers, accelerate productivity, and manage corporate risk, with a focus on the supply chain logistics industry.
column20: WiseTech Academy, online education, Registered Training Organisation

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: WiseTech's people across Australia, China, India, the Philippines, Singapore, and the United States participated in leadership training programs. WiseTech launched its new leadership program, Leadership Foundations (LeaF), which combines its previous leadership programs. The program is designed for people who have been in leadership roles for less than five years and is focused on developing essential leadership skills to build and run strong teams.
column20: Leadership Foundation, leadership program, leadership skill

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: Key technical and leadership training elements at WiseTech are delivered through peer-to-peer mentoring. WiseTech trains people to mentor colleagues, which enhances the effective onboarding of new technical team members and acts as a stepping stone towards leadership roles for existing team members. This year, 100 team members completed WiseTech's mentor training program across locations including China, Europe, India and Australia.
column20: Mentor training, peer-to-peer mentoring, technical team member

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: When new developers join WiseTech, they rotate through three teams during their first six months. It provides the opportunity to learn more about WiseTech's business and helps new hires find the area best suited to their skills and abilities. Over 300 software engineers and product specialists participated in the rotations program this year.
column20: Rotations program, new developer, software engineer

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: WiseTech updated its Managing Bias in People Decisions course and made this available on the WiseTech Academy platform, opening access beyond People Leaders to all team members. This year, completion of this course became mandatory for People Leaders and WiseTech's People and Talent teams.
column20: Managing Bias in People Decisions, WiseTech Academy, People and Talent team

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: WiseTech launched the WiseTech Diploma in International Freight Forwarding, offering a chance for newcomers to the industry to gain formal education on freight forwarding and for experienced professionals to enhance their knowledge and skills further. The Diploma covers all modes of transport and deepens knowledge in important topics such as greenhouse gases in the global supply chain, information technologies, risk and safety.
column20: WiseTech Diploma, International Freight Forwarding, supply chain

column6: Percentage of employees receiving regular performance and career development reviews
Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: WiseTech continued its partnership with Xceptional, a recruitment agency specialising in neurodivergent talent. Working with Xceptional enabled WiseTech to hire talented neurodivergent team members who have effectively brought unique skills and perspectives to WiseTech's teams, helping it become a more inclusive and innovative workplace.
column20: Xceptional, neurodivergent talent, innovative workplace

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: WiseTech hosted workshops across multiple time zones to help team members learn how to ally for the LGBTQ+ community and promote safety and inclusion in partnership with ACON's Pride in Diversity.
column20: LGBTQ+ workshop, Pride in Diversity, inclusion

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: WiseTech recognised Neurodiversity Celebration Week by sharing resources to help its people increase their understanding and work towards creating an inclusive workplace environment for neurodivergent people.
column20: Neurodiversity Celebration Week, inclusive workplace, neurodivergent people

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: WiseTech established an internal communications campaign to improve cross-cultural communication by sharing practical tips and webinars on indirect and direct communications and navigating common differences across cultures.
